overview

My primary research interests are in philosophy of language and cognitive science. More specifically, I'm interested in formal models of the influence of context on natural language interpretation. My dissertation explores ways of modeling linguistic focus as a tool used by interlocutors to collaboratively set the semantic value boundaries of expressions in their discourse. I think that the unique ways in which focus generally, and contrastive topic in particular, are implemented in conversation provide interesting motivation for characterizing the nature of semantic values as updates as opposed to contents. The class of phenomena I look at also have implications for the division of labor between the semantic and pragmatic interpretive effects of language use.
